Reviews.Title: “Softest bed on earth, but great location and suites...”
Reviews.Author: trvladdictsd
Reviews.Content: This is a suite property with wonderful rooms, centrally located so you can get everywhere in Phoenix within 45 min to an hour. Having a full kitchen and couch is fantastic. However... The bed was horrible. It was the softest bed I have slept in and that made for a restless night and sore back. The breakfast is free and pretty good selection that the staff tries to keep stocked. However, there were some teenage sports teams there while we were and they made breakfast a nightmare the last hour. If you go early, great. If you wait until the last hour you will battle for a seat and have to push your way through to every item and wait 30 minutes just to get to the waffle maker. This isn't the hotels fault exactly, but maybe they could have a seperate breakfast room for these groups. It would make all much happier. The pool looked nice, although I didn't use it. The staff was very pleasant. The property could use a few touchups here and there, but nothing worth complaining about beyond the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but for highway noise”
Reviews.Author: jegnm
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in two separate accommodations, studio and loft. Rooms were nicely furnished, beds comfortable. Service at the front desk was very helpful. Breakfast is a step up from normal hotel fare of this type. Even though we requested and stayed on the side away from the highway the noise was still always there. If this doesn't bother you this is an excellent place to stay. The location is central. Access is a little tricky but easy to get the hang of.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: crittersni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for a family gathering in Phoenix. The accomodations were great. Large king size bed was very comfortable. All amenities that could be asked for. Definitely would be a great place to stay for a longer trip. We were not able to avail ourselves of the breakfast as we had to leave early. Very clean. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice loft-type suites with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: pattilca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the highway. We requested a room away from the highway and the road noise was pretty minimal. The night we were there was a night with a special food bar. For us it was Taco Night. The food was good and was kept refilled. The hotel also provided complimentary beer and wine with the Taco Night. My husband and I booked a fireplace loft suite because we wanted a room with the fireplace. It was not clear on the Marriott website that some of these fireplace suites had wood burning fireplaces and not gas fireplaces. The rooms were very spacious and our suite could easily have allowed for a large family. It had two bathrooms and two large sleeping areas as well as the couch.

Reviews.Title: “One Important Tip”
Reviews.Author: KevinTorontoCanada29
Reviews.Content: This is a typical older Residence Inn: Clean Room, Good Buffet. It is on the highway so convenient to get around BUT make sure you get a room NOT facing the highway because you can hear the road noise in the room. Front Desk was nice and changed our room for us

Reviews.Title: “good location was good for us”
Reviews.Author: gak909
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend a family wedding. Activites were north and south of us, so this location was wonderful. We did not realize it was on a frontage rd, which made it one way in and one out. Once we got the feel of where we were it was easy to get in and out. Breakfast was very good and hot. Was good to see protein with eggs and sausage and yogurt as well. All the other normal breakfast items as well. We were in about the middle of the complex and had a hard time finding parking one night when we returned very late in the a.m. hrs. We also liked that it was close to the airport (about 20 mins with traffic) Did not use the pool or hottub, but we saw others in it. We were just too busy with family and friends. We also had a fireplace, made it seems homey, although it was too warm to try it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Issues”
Reviews.Author: geeimjoe
Reviews.Content: I chose this facility due to reviews made on Tripadvisor. Overall my room was clean and everything worked. I will say with I-17 freeway being so close I was able to count the cars at night, especially trucks. The room I was assigned is toward the rear of the property so things can't be better closer toward the freeway. I attempted to make a toll free call from my room two hours after arriving and could not dial out. Searching for assistance I called the front desk and was told to give it a "little time" and they would have the problem solved. A half hour went by with better results so I called the front desk again. I was told someone was going to come to my room to remedy the issue. No representative came to my room. I made four calls in three hours. After three hours passed they quit answering my calls so I called their main number from my cell phone. I asked to speak with a supervisor and was told he had just left for the day. The person answering, Johnny, asked if he could assist me so I told him who I was and was in room ---. He said please hold. I did for a few minutes. Johnny came back on the line and said "try it now". I did and it worked. Whatever Johnny did he could have done in the previous hours. It was a very frustrating experience. Last night with rain falling in Phoenix I was awakened many times with the loud sound of a lot of rain pouring on something metal. This morning I went outside to find out what kept me awake most of the night. On the back of the building there are no gutters nor overhang from the roof. Rain from the roof was falling straight down and falling on a metal security light. That light was opposite the headboard. There might as well not even been a wall between the light and the headboard as it was loud enough to keep anyone awake all night. One other issue was upon driving up to my room after being gone all day I found a male employee attempting to enter my room. I asked what he wanted and he said there was a water leak in my room. After examining the kitchen and bath there was not a water leak anywhere. Not sure what his intentions were beyond that I was puzzled as to his true agenda. I am thankful I came back to my room when I did. There are many places to stay in Phoenix. My suggestion is to try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: sea_cruise86
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the photos of this property, but was disappointed for many reasons on arrival. Even with our GPS we had difficulty finding this property. The road leading to the front office looks as if it is leading to a parking lot for an adjacent apartment complex. It is a one-way road. Upon arrival we were informed that the room we had reserved was not available as the people who were in it previously had not left. We had booked a two night stay. There were no similar rooms available. We were then given what they call an 'upgraded' room. I respectfully disagree. Although it was also a two-bedroom two bath unit, it was facing the freeway and was upstairs in a two story building with no elevator. It was also at the furthest point from the main house and pool area which we had requested to be near. I called the front desk to complain and was told there was nothing they could do unless somebody in one of the other rooms we wanted checked out. We had booked the two bedroom two bath penthouse with loft with a much more open floorplan. This room was more like what you would find if somebody converted an old hotel and just joined three regular rooms together in a row placing the living room in the middle. The next morning I went to the front office and voiced my concerns about the room again. I was once again told that I should be happy since it was an 'upgrade'. I was then told to pack up all of our belongings and place them in the middle of the living room floor. That way if somebody did check out then they would send maintenance to move our belongings to the new room. I was so displeased with the room we were in that I was glad to do at least that. When we returned we found that indeed we had been moved. I was pleased with the accommodations the second night that overlooked the pool area. The breakfast area at this hotel was lacking. Not nearly enough food and some weird spices were used to cook some of it. I would expect more consistency throughout the chain than this. I did witness the front desk clerk yelling at a homeless man who wandered in and began to eat. Overall it was just ok. I would personally not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: zonagurl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here! Rooms are cute and spacious with a full kitchen and huge flat screen tv! I am a stickler for cleanliness and the room was truly A-OK! Complimentary breakfast is great! At check-in they offer coffees, teas and fruit which is a nice welcome! We stayed in July and its soooo hot in Phx during this time...the AC at this location was bumpn cooool and thats always a huge PLUS while in the Phx heat!! Staff is friendly and just overall a nice place to crash :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt J
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed it here. Location, rooms, staff, everything was great! We would go back. There's nothing to think. Just go for it. I definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great Room, Friendly Staff, Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELMATES2005
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3yr old, and I stayed one night at this hotel before traveling to our vacation destination in Flagstaff. The room was spacious and very clean and had the following: Huge flat screen TV with free cable and on-demand purchase available, nice couch, small business area, free wifi, fireplace, full kitchen (refrigerator, microwave, stove, sink) with granite countertops, bathroom vanity area (granite countertops), clean shower/tub combo, nice decor, large comfortable bed, card access to the room door, and the air conditioner worked well. Check-in was a breeze, and they even had our last name on a placard with several other names as guest arriving for the day which I thought was a nice touch. The staff was very friendly. There is an evening light meal served as well as a hot breakfast in the clubhouse type check-in area which includes a soft drink fountain dispenser with several choices as well as a large flatscreen TV to catch up on the evening or morning news, weather, or sports. There were several tables and chairs in and around this area. There are drinks and snacks available all hours of the day for purchase that are located to the right of the front desk. They had a huge selection of pamphlets with activities for the area near the front desk which was very helpful. The pool was very clean and gated. They had a great play area with a slide and climbing area just outside our room location with a bench for us to sit on while our child enjoyed himself. This was a great convenience to allow him to blow off some energy stored up from the long travel time that day. The grounds for the hotel were immaculate, and we felt very safe once on the hotel property. We did go the back way to get to the hotel thanks to our GPS. There are some areas on the way that are not as nice as you would like them to be, but this was no different than any other city I have traveled to or lived in. The Hotel is right off I-17 north with easy access via West Northern Ave. then right on North 27th Ave. and right on West Butler Drive and finally right on North Black Canyon Highway which is the way we should have traveled. This would have been much more convenient, but our GPS had other ideas LOL. With the price match guarantee from Marriott, we booked this room for 46 dollars which was a steal! I loved this hotel and so did my family.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: sunytrvler
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels about 80 nights a year for work and often need to stay in Phoenix. This by far is one of my favorites in Phoenix. The neighborhood is definitely in the hood, but even as a single female, I always felt safe and secure. This is the cleanest hotel I've stayed in all year. The dishes and silverware were immaculate. Last year I stayed at a high end kitchenette hotel in Scottsdale and the dishes were so dirty it made me not want to touch anything else in the place. Small workout room but the free LA Fitness down the street makes up for it. Just show them your hotel key. Breakfast is a feast of eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, cereal, bagels, bread, waffles and sausage. Free. Free wifi too. Beds are heavenly. Truly, the best nights sleep. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, with friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Adventursaurus
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night, but wished I had discovered this hotel sooner and would have stayed the whole 3 days. The check-in clerk was helpful and accommodating. Everyone seemed focused on being helpful. The place was organized and breakfast was delicious. My only critique was that the self service breakfast including waffle iron did not work well. Children were operating the irons, so batter was a bit messy and I spent 15-20 minutes to make my waffle. I hope they reconsider the one at a time waffles, with tons of guests timing can be bad. Food options were great, but get there early!! Overall we had a wonderful time. I would easily recommend and stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwawa
Reviews.Content: I was on business in Phoenix for one week and I decided what better place to stay than a Residence Inn by Marriott because of their full kitchen. The value and amenities makes this hotel VERY GOOD. I did not rate them an excellent due to their average service. If their front desk were nicer and more sincere they undoubtedly would be an A+ property. The room had a full kitchen equipped with everything you could possibly need, a separate sitting area with a nice flat screen tv, a comfy bed, clean bathroom and vanity, complimentary full hot breakfast, and complimentary dinner on certain days. The only major downside is that the hotel may be confusing to access. It's a little tricky finding the entrance from the highway. Nevertheless, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: -NoOwl-
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super amazing! It had a loft and it was very private and roomy. Free breakfast was great! Probably the best i've had at a hotel. The location was very awkward. Even with mapquest and gps from our phones it was very confusing to get there. But once we got there there was no problem :) Its located right by a freeway but you can't hear anything and i know we all felt safe. All in all i would say its an AMAZING hotel for the price. There was 5 of us and it didn't even feel slightly cramped. If your traveling with a fair amount of people and you want something cheap, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinLorie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about our stay! Our room was spacious and cozy. It was cleaned everyday and coffee was always replenished for the next day. They even washed our dishes. The free breakfast was delicious with a large variety of breakfast foods. The evening managers dinner was also delicious. The grounds were kept very beautiful and the pool was very inviting. We will come back to this hotel and recommend it to others. Kudos to everyone who keeps this hotel so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise! A spacious room with lots of amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Evils_TravelAgent
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest hotel (thank you Priceline) on our trip and it was by far the nicest. We only stayed there a night, but I wish it'd been two. The room was so spacious with a nice full kitchen, an island/bar eating space, sitting area for the tv complete with couch, desk work space, and (privately tucked around the corner) a large vanity area with separate bathroom. The pool and whirlpool area were nice, the breakfast was delicious and staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate stopover, value for money !”
Reviews.Author: ErkaBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in a penthouse suite when traveling from San Diego towards Flagstaff. I found this hotel to offer good value for money. The property was clean, there was plenty of space and everything was in good working condition. A good choice for a stop-over hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Homey; location not so great”
Reviews.Author: jessotr
Reviews.Content: For a Marriott, this one is lower down the list of nice places. The location is just bland, off a frontage road. The surrounding businesses aren't too nice. We got the cheap weekend rate, and apparently a bunch of bikers and families with loud kids did as well. The room itself was pretty nice, with a good size kitchen including oven, full size fridge, and dishes. The room was clean and comfortable. The wireless internet was free, but not 100% reliable. I would stay here again for a short time, but only for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: gabigoose
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at Residence Inn properties across the country. This Residence Inn does not meet the standards of most of the other properties in this chain. My room was partially renovated to look like a typical updated Residence Inn room, but with close inspection the room was pretty shabby and dated. The breakfast was not well stocked, and they even ran out of forks one day (although one evening the dinner reception was quite nice as far as being well stocked). Some of the towels in my room smelled odd…almost like gasoline. My phone didn’t work upon check-in. The internet connection in my room was poor, making it impossible to compose lengthy email messages. The TV was frustrating as it was slow to respond after pressing the channel change button on the remote. There were no towels to be found around the pool area. The employees mostly lacked polish and finesse. My stay wasn’t awful, but it was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: pkcasa
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn is perfectly acceptable, but not remarkable. We stayed there for $68/night as a result of a Priceline bid. I would not spend over $100/night for the accommodation. The location, by Metrocenter mall off of I-17, was central for us, only because we were attending baseball games from Surprise all the way to Mesa. However the hotel is in a working class neighborhood without a large variety of interesting places to visit if you are a tourist. I would much more recommend staying in the Scottsdale area for that. The suites were large and had all the essentials. The kitchen in particular was quite well equipped. The bed was too small, however, the mattress was too soft and the sheets did not fit right. The bathroom is set up well, with the sink and a large vanity area outside the smaller tub/toilet room. That area really needed a refresh. The pool and hot tub area was quite nice, in a central patio area by the gatehouse. There are many shaded tables. We only tried the complimentary morning breakfast once, but it was acceptable. From Monday to Thursday there is also a free light dinner which is welcome if you like it. Although there was typically a computer available in the business center it was stolen while we were there. Management was gracious to allow guests to print boarding passes from their own offices. Overall, the stay was fine but not memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate; nothing particularly outstanding. Free internet is slow”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaticSoul
Reviews.Content: Spent several weeks here on business. Location is OK; easy to access the interstate, there are several corner stores in the area. Neighborhood might be a bit sketchy, but it's not terrible - I never felt unsafe. A few chain restaurants in the immediate area (Lone Star, Outback, Fuddruckers), and many others only a few minutes away. Per the title, their free internet access was particularly slow and unreliable for me. Rooms and layout was OK; would have preferred a TV that you would more easily adjust such that you could watch it from the bed. Staff seemed professional and efficient. Did not try the food or pool. Restaurant right next door called Bobby-Q has excellent food - especially ribs. Barstaff were quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Puzzled over last reviews. I enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: Call_Me_Mo
Reviews.Content: i booked my stay directly with Marriott and got a great auto club rate of $90. I wanted to catch a Coyotes Hockey game in Glendale, and on the map it said only 20 minutes from the arena. I took the main road to Glendale, and yes, it was only 20 minutes! Now, I am not sure why the others posted a nasty review. I had a great stay. Room: I stayed in the back, in room 814, a studio room in the lower of a 2 story complex. Very quiet!! Maybe those other people stayed in the front.. if so, ask for building 8 or 7. My room was near the pool but I didn't use it. The room itself was plenty big for 2 people. The king bed was adequate but the pillows were very flat, so if you like firm pillows, either bring your own, or ask for more. The kitchen had enough utensils and accessories for 4 people, and the R.I. will also go grocery shopping for you, if you dont have the time! Fortunately they also had a frozen food area in the lobby so I got some lean cuisines and ate that as a late night snack. Nice feature: The room had a fireplace and a separate sitting area for TV, and a desk for work. You can get the apprpriate "firelog" at the front desk, but since it was 90 degees outside, we didn't bother. We did watch TV with the free microwave popcorn though! Bathroom: The water pressure in my room was great! The soap was teeny tiny, so if you need a BAR of soap, bring your own. Extra freebies: The hotel offers a light dinner on weekdays (Mon-Thurs). The menu is posted in the room and on Thursdays it seems they have a BBQ by the pool!! WOW! My stay was on a weekend, and I got a complimentary hot breakfast. They had a medley of food!! Cold cereals, hot eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuit n gravy, fresh fruit, yogurt, breads, juice , milk, coffee, tea, cocoa, and do it yourself waffles, which were a snap to make!! Bad part: Ok, I had to write this one... my neighbors upstairs were either elephants or the hotel had thin floors. When they got home at 10 pm, I could hear their footsteps. I called the front desk to remind my neighbors, but it was still noisy. Lucky I am a sound sleeper, but if you are not then ask for an upstairs unit! Plenty of parking, and the neighborhood is not that bad. We're not talking South Central LA here!! Around the corner of the hotel is a great gas station (great gas price), a Kmart and a grocery store. Unless you are planning on paying $300-400 a night for a Gem of a location, this hotel is perfect for a 1 or 2 night stay. (I spent that kind of money in Paris and stayed in a dump neighborhood!)

Reviews.Title: “Barely Adequate”
Reviews.Author: bearossop
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe this is in the Marriott family of hotels. The location is terrible, right on the freeway in a pretty sketch neighborhood. If you're a light sleeper, forget about it; the freeway noise is loud and constant. The maintenance guy who kindly let me into my room that I locked myself out of observed "it's so loud! It's hard to hear!" and laughed. Yeah, that's pretty funny. What else? The rooms are all in various states of disrepair, despite having recent upgrades. Maintenance requests go unanswered. Nice pergo kitchens, I will say. No exercise facilities. Tiny pool monopolized by teenagers with mulletts. No restaurant facilities, and your nearby options are quite limited because why? Oh yeah, sketch neighborhood. There's a bbq place (very hit or miss) and a burger king. And a pollo loco. Good luck! Sadly, the company I work for is relocating here, so many of my colleagues are also trapped in this hell-hole. Although we're bringing lots of steady business, we're routinely given bad rooms...assuming of course that there are actually good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Residence Inn. It was very open and airy. The staff were helpful and friendly. The children loved having the pool all to themselves as this is primarily a business hotel. The little touches make it homey and inviting such as a candy dish and complimentary popcorn packet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: MichelleSF
Reviews.Content: Huge apartment-style rooms with full kitchens are nice. So is the bag of popcorn the hotel leaves near your microwave. Decor is a little worn, but not horrible. The bed is pretty uncomfortable -- it's more of a mattress pad than a mattress. Hotel is right on the freeway, surrounded by a ton of chain restaurants and other hotels. I'm not really a chain restaurant fan, but we had a surprisingly good dinner at the Lone Star Grill across the freeway. Continental breakfast was heavy -- waffles, biscuits and gravy, etc. -- but not great. Fruit was very bruised. But it did the trick and got us started on our day.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 8242 N Black Canyon Freeway, Phoenix, AZ 85051
